intro: Euplassa organensis subsp. laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered euplassa, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats, such as forest understories, where it thrives in nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are arranged in a loose, open inflorescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in conservation assessments.
